        public ArrayPair getYellowPolynomial()

      • rgbToXYChromaticity

        public float[] rgbToXYChromaticity(int r,
                                   int g,
                                   int b)
        convert from CIE XYZ 1931, to CIE XY chromaticity 1931. useful for more information: http://www.efg2.com/Lab/Graphics/Colors/Chromaticity.htm http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/CIE_1931_color_space http://hyperphysics.phy-astr.gsu.edu/hbase/vision/cie.html
        Parameters:
        r -
        g -
        b -
        Returns:

      • rgbToXYChromaticity

        public void rgbToXYChromaticity(int r,
                                int g,
                                int b,
                                float[] outputcieXY)
        convert from CIE XYZ 1931, to CIE XY chromaticity 1931. useful for more information: http://www.efg2.com/Lab/Graphics/Colors/Chromaticity.htm http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/CIE_1931_color_space http://hyperphysics.phy-astr.gsu.edu/hbase/vision/cie.html
        Parameters:
        r -
        g -
        b -
        outputcieXY - the float array of length 2 that the output will be placed in.

        g -
        b -

      • isWhite2

        public boolean isWhite2(float cieX,
                        float cieY)
        returns roughly whether the CIE (X,Y) coordinate lands within the large white zone in the center of the diagram. Note that this returns true for grey too, so test for lower intensities first
        Parameters:
        cieX -
        cieY -
        Returns:

      • calculateXYTheta

        public double calculateXYTheta(float cieX,
                               float cieY)
        calculate the angle in radians of the point (cieX, cieY) in the CIE chromaticity diagram with respect to an origin of (0.35, 0.35). Note that one should check for white before using this as the resulting angle will not be a significant answer if it is. The angles are 
            90(=pi/2)
            |
            |
   180 ----------- 0
   (=pi)    |
            | 
          270(=3pi/2)
        Parameters:
        cieX -
        cieY -
        Returns:
        the angle in radians of the point (cieX, cieY) with respect to an origin of (0.35, 0.35). The invoker should check the original r,g,b for black and white to avoid use here. A value of -1 is returned for white.
